summary: Cuba is an island country in the Caribbean Sea, made up of over 4,000 islands. It has a long history, with early inhabitants dating back to 4000 BC. Spain colonized it in the 15th century, and it later became a US colony after the Spanish-American War. In 1959, Fidel Castro led a revolution, establishing a communist government. Cuba faced challenges during the Cold War and after the Soviet Union's fall. Today, it is a socialist state with an authoritarian government. Cuba is known for its diverse culture, influenced by indigenous, Spanish, African, and Soviet elements. Its economy relies on tourism and exports.
title: Cuba
